Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed streaky black (fired reddish) below; two bands in added white near bottom of sherd; traces of faded added white floral motif, possibly rosettes and pomegranates; top of rim glazed; exterior: short diagonal stroke pattern at rim above broken maeander pattern between bands; below, painted decoration consisting of part of rump and body with reserved underbelly of feline or goat, to right; pendant triangle as filling ornament; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd within the Mature Animal Style, however, the presence of a goat as decoration and the lack of interior decoration suggests that the sherd is earlier and in the Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 63, no. 716, pl. XXI, no. 716)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 678, no. 367)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 254, no. 436) (Incorrectly labelled 1886.6-1.181)
Smith C 1888 / Acquisitions of British Museum (p. 233)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0209) (phase 2)
